724222f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Little West 12th Street
724222f-a.text:
(1)
Washington Street, east side, from Little West 12th Street, to
and including Gansevoort Street.
April 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same; showing a closer view of the corner proper.
April 2, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724222f-a.folder: Washington Street & Little West 12th Street, Manhattan, NY

724220f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Little West 12th Street
724220f-a.text:
(1)
Washington Street, west side, north from and including Little
West 12th Street, after the demolition of the loft buildings
between Little West 12th and 13th Streets. Washington Street
bends at this point and runs north for two blocks, parallel
to Ninth Avenue, and ends at 14th Street.
July 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same twenty-one months later, showing the demolition of 443
West 13th Street and the two old tenement houses at 445-447.
Behind them may be seen the top of the new building at 452
West 14th Street.
March 12, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
The same, seventeen days after (2), showing a pile driver at
work in the clearing between Little West 12th Street and 13th
Street. This view is from Gansevoort Market Stand, a little west
of Washington Street.
March 29, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724220f-a.folder: Washington Street & Little West 12th Street, Manhattan, NY

724221f-b.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Little West 12th Street
724221f-b.text:
Washington Street, east side, north from Little West 12th., to and
including West 13th Streets. Also shown is Little West 12th Street,
at and adjoining the N.E. corner of Washington Street. In the fore-
ground, appears a portion of Gansevoort Market Stand.
July 28, 1931.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The same, showing a further view on Little West 12th Street.
July 28, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724221f-b.folder: Washington Street & Little West 12th Street, Manhattan, NY

724219f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Little West 12th Street
724219f-a.text:
(1)
Washington Street, east side, north from Little West 12th Street,
showing also the cleared west side from Little West 12th to
13th Streets.
July 28, 1931.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, nearly two years later, just before the work began
on the New York Central elevated roadbed. In the right back-
ground mwy be seen the top of the new Port Authority Building.
March 16, 1933.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
Washington Street and New York Central elevated roadbed, north
from Gansevoort Market Stand south and west of Little West 12th
and Washington Streets.
April 3, 1934.
L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
724219f-a.folder: Washington Street & Little West 12th Street, Manhattan, NY

P. L. Sperr.

719978f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Little West 12th Street
719978f-a.text:
Gansevoort Market Stand; its southern half, viewed southwestward from
the S.W. corner of Washington and Little West 12th Streets. It is one
of New York's leading wholesale trucking plaoes; most of the produce
arriving from Metropolitan New Jersey, Long lIsland, Connecticut and
Staten Island.
About 1925.
Ewing Galloway.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
719978f-a.folder: Washington Street & Little West 12th Street, Manhattan, NY

724223f-a.title: Manhattan: Washington Street - Little West 12th Street
724223f-a.text:
Washington Street, east side, from Little West 12th to Jane Streets.
July 9, 1932.
.. Sperr.  P. 1
NO REPRODUCTIDNS.
